6c148cef-bf09-4d94-8e53-7c5fa1ebd27c: A divine guardian gains a bonus {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feat{/g} at 7th level, and additional bonus feats at 10th and 13th level. These bonus feats must be chosen from the following list: Combat Reflexes, Diehard, Dodge, Endurance, Great Fortitude, Improved Great Fortitude, Iron Will, Improved Iron Will, Lightning Reflexes, Improved Lightning Reflexes, Missile Shield, Shield Focus, Toughness, or Tower Shield Proficiency.
c33b63a4-7ffc-491a-9cba-ddc219a1fc15: A flaming burst weapon functions as a flaming weapon that also explodes with flame upon striking a successful {g|Encyclopedia:Critical}critical hit{/g}. The fire does not harm the wielder. In addition to the extra {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}fire damage{/g} from the flaming ability, a flaming burst weapon deals an extra 1d10 points of fire {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} on a successful critical hit. If the weapon's critical multiplier is ×3, add an extra 2d10 points of fire damage instead, and if the multiplier is ×4, add an extra 3d10 points of fire damage.
e9109598-f4f4-42bd-8987-1e17cefa4119:
A paladin can add the axiomatic property to a weapon enhanced with her divine weapon bond, but this consumes 2 points of enhancement {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} granted to this weapon.
An axiomatic weapon is infused with lawful power. It makes the weapon {g|Encyclopedia:Alignment}lawful-aligned{/g} and thus overcomes the corresponding {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Reduction}damage reduction{/g}. It deals an extra {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}2d6{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} against chaotic creatures.
4a0f7cae-a65c-4571-a1d4-572e339a2fac:
A paladin can add the brilliant energy property to a weapon enhanced with her divine weapon bond, but this consumes 4 points of enhancement {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} granted to this weapon.
A brilliant energy weapon ignores nonliving matter. Armor and shield bonuses to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g} (including any enhancement bonuses to that armor) do not count against it because the weapon passes through armor. ({g|Encyclopedia:Dexterity}Dexterity{/g}, deflection, dodge, natural armor, and other such bonuses still apply.) A brilliant energy weapon cannot harm undead, constructs, or objects.
01d576af-cf69-48eb-99c0-5b6ec40d26b3:
A paladin can add the disruption property to a weapon enhanced with her divine weapon bond, but this consumes 2 points of enhancement {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} granted to this weapon.
A disruption weapon is the bane of all undead. Any undead creature struck in combat must succeed on a {g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} 14 {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Will save{/g} or be destroyed. A disruption weapon must be a {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Type}bludgeoning{/g} melee weapon.
668a2d0c-f069-4726-b636-cd9b49ef08e7: A paladin can add the flaming burst property to a weapon enhanced with her divine weapon bond, but this consumes 2 points of enhancement {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} granted to this weapon. A flaming burst weapon functions as a flaming weapon that also explodes with flame upon striking a successful {g|Encyclopedia:Critical}critical hit{/g}. The fire does not harm the wielder. In addition to the extra {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}fire damage{/g} from the flaming ability, a flaming burst weapon deals an extra 1d10 points of fire {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} on a successful critical hit. If the weapon's critical multiplier is ×3, add an extra 2d10 points of fire damage instead, and if the multiplier is ×4, add an extra 3d10 points of fire damage.
f76d496c-d2f0-4e9a-b2fa-635475b4d4a8:
A paladin can add the flaming property to a weapon enhanced with her divine weapon bond, but this consumes 1 point of enhancement {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} granted to this weapon.
A flaming weapon is sheathed in fire that deals an extra {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}fire damage{/g} on a successful hit. The fire does not harm the wielder.
dbf2d336-ba41-4976-b713-e551fbb8232c:
A paladin can add the holy property to a weapon enhanced with her divine weapon bond, but this consumes 2 points of enhancement {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} granted to this weapon.
A holy weapon is imbued with holy power. This power makes the weapon {g|Encyclopedia:Alignment}good-aligned{/g} and thus overcomes the corresponding {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Reduction}damage reduction{/g}. It deals an extra {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}2d6{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} against all creatures of evil alignment.
ffb26f99-5193-4513-add8-fbcb190ffead:
A paladin can add the keen property to a weapon enhanced with her divine weapon bond, but this consumes 1 point of enhancement {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} granted to this weapon.
The keen property doubles the threat range of a weapon. This benefit doesn't stack with any other effects that expand the threat range of a weapon (such as the keen edge {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} or the Improved {g|Encyclopedia:Critical}Critical{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feat{/g}).
7c423f98-5758-408d-ae90-464e2b3de1ac:
A paladin can add the speed property to a weapon enhanced with her divine weapon bond, but this consumes 3 points of enhancement {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} granted to this weapon.
When making a full {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g}, the wielder of a speed weapon may make one extra attack with it. The attack uses the wielder's full {g|Encyclopedia:BAB}base attack bonus{/g}, plus any modifiers appropriate to the situation. (This benefit is not cumulative with similar effects, such as a haste {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}.)
b7dbedb6-7332-4a3f-b88a-5d85eff5a235:
A paladin can call out to the powers of good to aid her in her struggle against evil. As a {g|Encyclopedia:Swift_Action}swift action{/g}, the paladin chooses one target within sight to smite. If this target is evil, the paladin adds her {g|Encyclopedia:Charisma}Charisma{/g} bonus (if any) to her {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack rolls{/g} and adds her paladin level to all {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage rolls{/g} made against the target of her smite, smite evil attacks automatically bypass any {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Reduction}DR{/g} the creature might possess.
In addition, while smite evil is in effect, the paladin gains a deflection {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} equal to her Charisma bonus (if any) to her {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g} against attacks made by the target of the smite. If the paladin targets a creature that is not evil, the smite is wasted with no effect. The smite evil lasts until the target dies or the paladin selects a new target.
af1e37c3-78e9-41b3-82a5-9db4d1c778e1: A paladin can {g|Encyclopedia:Healing}heal{/g} her wounds as a {g|Encyclopedia:Swift_Action}swift action{/g}. With one use of this ability, a paladin can heal {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:HP}hit points{/g} of damage for every two paladin levels she possesses.
40e7a1fc-9ba9-4884-a462-d11bc1f5e79c:
A paladin can {g|Encyclopedia:Healing}heal{/g} the wounds of others by touch. With one use of this ability, a paladin can heal {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:HP}hit points{/g} of damage for every two paladin levels she possesses. Using this ability is a {g|Encyclopedia:Standard_Actions}standard action{/g}.
Alternatively, a paladin can use this healing power to deal {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} to undead creatures, dealing 1d6 points of damage for every two levels the paladin possesses. Using lay on hands in this way requires a successful melee {g|Encyclopedia:TouchAttack}touch attack{/g} and doesn't provoke an {g|Encyclopedia:Attack_Of_Opportunity}attack of opportunity{/g}. Undead do not receive a {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throw{/g} against this damage.
74529612-f72c-427d-ab16-56ba4a2455b7: A paladin who ceases to be lawful good loses all paladin {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g} and class features. She cannot thereafter gain levels as a paladin until she changes the {g|Encyclopedia:Alignment}alignment{/g} back.
e179d03f-64fd-49e2-af98-9dc77cba39e0: A stonelord is a devoted sentinel of dwarven enclaves, drawing the power of the earth and ancient stone to protect her people.
8d34f7d5-6a21-459c-ae93-4e4faf7bb3d8: As a {g|Encyclopedia:Standard_Actions}standard action{/g}, the martyr can chant hymns of faith and cause bleeding stigmata to visibly appear on his body; at 7th level, he can manifest stigmata as a {g|Encyclopedia:Move_Action}move action{/g}, and at 13th level, he can do so as a {g|Encyclopedia:Swift_Action}swift action{/g}. He can use this ability a number of {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}rounds{/g} per day equal to (4 + his {g|Encyclopedia:Charisma}Charisma{/g} modifier) at 1st level, plus 1 additional round per day for each level beyond 1st. While his stigmata are active, he takes 1 point of bleed {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g}, which automatically ceases when he ends this ability but otherwise does not relent, even in the face of magical {g|Encyclopedia:Healing}healing{/g} or Heal {g|Encyclopedia:Check}checks{/g}. His stigmata assist his allies, duplicating inspire courage bardic performance of a bard of his paladin level. At 10th level, he can choose to duplicate the effects of inspire greatness. At 16th level, he can choose to duplicate the effects of inspire heroics.
4b4bfc2e-3095-4240-94ec-a0021f009a73: At 11th level, a divine hunter can expend a use of her smite evil ability as a {g|Encyclopedia:Swift_Action}swift action{/g} to grant herself and all allies within 10 feet the Deadly Aim, Precise Shot, and Improved Precise Shot {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feats{/g}, even if they lack the prerequisites. The effects last for 1 minute. Evil creatures gain no benefit from this ability.
dcbe4873-901f-4405-a483-c8e7f39932c1: At 11th level, a hospitaler is immune to death effects. Each ally within 10 feet of her gains a +4 morale {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throws{/g} against death effects. This ability functions only while the paladin is conscious, not if she is {g|Encyclopedia:Injury_Death}unconscious{/g} or dead.
9bbaa568-6004-468e-a712-108565d4666c:
At 11th level, a paladin can expend two uses of her smite evil ability to grant the ability to smite evil to all allies for 1 minute, using her bonuses. As a {g|Encyclopedia:Swift_Action}swift action{/g}, the paladin chooses one target within sight to smite. If this target is evil, the paladin's allies add her {g|Encyclopedia:Charisma}Charisma{/g} bonus (if any) to their {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack rolls{/g} and add her paladin level to all {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage rolls{/g} made against the target of her smite. Smite evil attacks automatically bypass any {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Reduction}DR{/g} the creature might possess.
In addition, while smite evil is in effect, the paladin's allies gain a deflection {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} equal to her Charisma bonus (if any) to their {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g} against attacks made by the target of this smite. If the paladin targets a creature that is not evil, this smite is wasted with no effect.
609d3614-a857-4a41-bb9c-20fd16a93d66:
At 11th level, a paladin can expend two uses of her smite evil ability to grant the ability to smite evil to all allies for 1 minute, using her bonuses. As a {g|Encyclopedia:Swift_Action}swift action{/g}, the paladin chooses one target within sight to smite. If this target is evil, the paladin's allies add her {g|Encyclopedia:Charisma}Charisma{/g} bonus (if any) to their {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack rolls{/g} and add her paladin level to all {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage rolls{/g} made against the target of her smite. Smite evil attacks automatically bypass any {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Reduction}DR{/g} the creature might possess.
In addition, while smite evil is in effect, the paladin's allies gain a deflection {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} equal to her Charisma bonus (if any) to their {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g} against attacks made by the target of this smite. If the paladin targets a creature that is not evil, this smite is wasted with no effect. The mark of justice lasts until the paladin selects a new target.
9b9d3134-ae36-47db-9042-1dd3698b4493: At 11th level, the mount gains the celestial creature simple template.
c1543abb-7cc2-476d-bf9a-0ee80b544331: At 11th level, when using stonestrike, a stonelord's {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} gains the construct bane special weapon ability.
58723e0a-3e7a-4eef-815f-6966e7975ede: At 12th level, the nimbus of light grants allies in the area {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Resistance}resistance{/g} 30 to fire, acid, cold, electricity and sonic energy.
b4608503-b872-4c19-b47a-c41fec888a21: At 14th level, a divine hunter's ranged weapons are treated as {g|Encyclopedia:Alignment}good-aligned{/g} for the purposes of overcoming {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Reduction}damage reduction{/g}. Any {g|Encyclopedia:RangedAttack}ranged attacks{/g} made by an ally within 10 feet of her are likewise treated as good-aligned for the purposes of overcoming {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} reduction. This ability functions only while the divine hunter is conscious.
47e49900-550b-4f1c-9aa3-c04a6f08ae48:
At 14th level, a paladin's weapons are treated as {g|Encyclopedia:Alignment}good-aligned{/g} for the purposes of overcoming {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Reduction}damage reduction{/g}. Any {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} made against an enemy within 10 feet of her is treated as good-aligned for the purposes of overcoming {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} reduction.
This ability functions only while the paladin is conscious, not if she is {g|Encyclopedia:Injury_Death}unconscious{/g} or dead.
1f66e503-3cd7-4611-9071-91a82f8da652: At 14th level, a warrior of the holy light can unleash a 30-foot burst of pure, white light as a {g|Encyclopedia:Standard_Actions}standard action{/g}. evil creatures within this burst take ({g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} for every two paladin levels) points of {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} and are blinded for 1 {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g}. Evil dragons, evil outsiders, and evil undead are blinded for 1d4 rounds on a failed {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}save{/g}. A Reflex save halves this damage and negates the blindness. The {g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} of this save is equal to 10 + 1/2 the warrior of the holy light's level + the warrior of the holy light's {g|Encyclopedia:Charisma}Charisma{/g} modifier. good creatures within this burst are healed 1d6 points of damage per two paladin levels and receive a +2 sacred {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Ability_Scores}ability checks{/g}, {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack rolls{/g}, saving throws, and {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skill checks{/g} for 1 round. A warrior of the holy light can use this ability once per day at 14th level plus one additional time per day at 17th and 20th levels.
20df536a-7967-461c-9dd9-5ed511fc7846: At 15th level, a paladin's mount gains {g|Encyclopedia:Spell_Resistance}spell resistance{/g} equal to the paladin's level + 11.
bf2be577-411e-4144-a438-dd451e888772: At 16th level, the nimbus of light grants the warrior of the holy light and her allies protection from {g|Encyclopedia:Critical}critical hits{/g}. There is a 25% chance that critical hits made against the warrior of the holy light and her allies in the area are instead treated as normal hits. This does not stack with other abilities that grant similar protection (such as light fortification).
489326c2-97bc-483f-824d-66fcac141bc3:
At 17th level, a paladin gains {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Reduction}DR{/g} 5/evil and immunity to compulsion {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:Special_Abilities}spell-like abilities{/g}. Each ally within 10 feet of her gains a +4 morale {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throws{/g} against compulsion effects.
This ability functions only while the paladin is conscious, not if she is {g|Encyclopedia:Injury_Death}unconscious{/g} or dead.
9c451421-a04c-479e-969a-beee9b8bd19b: At 20th level, a paladin becomes a conduit for the power of her god. Her {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Reduction}DR{/g} increases to 10/evil and whenever she channels positive energy or uses lay on hands to {g|Encyclopedia:Healing}heal{/g} a creature, she heals the maximum possible amount.
43a34651-1b70-4ef1-990c-dffc17f0b8c4: At 20th level, a stonelord's body transforms into living stone. She no longer needs to eat, drink, breathe, or sleep, and she becomes immune to paralysis, poison, and stunning. She also becomes immune to {g|Encyclopedia:Critical}critical hits{/g} and precision {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g}.
c1e1fac3-8ac2-4a07-a9ab-d022f0d37744: At 20th level, the nimbus of light increases in {g|Encyclopedia:Size}size{/g} out to a range of 50 feet. In addition, all of its bonuses increase. The morale {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g} and on {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack rolls{/g}, {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage rolls{/g}, and {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throws{/g} against fear increases to +2. The amount of {g|Encyclopedia:AbilityDamage}ability damage{/g} healed increases to {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}2d4{/g}. Finally, protection against {g|Encyclopedia:Critical}critical hits{/g} increases to 50%.
f16e064f-96a7-46a6-9afa-089964d1f877: At 2nd level, a paladin gains a {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} equal to her {g|Encyclopedia:Charisma}Charisma{/g} bonus (if any) on all {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throws{/g}.
f75717d0-095e-4ce6-b52e-09c59720c6d1: At 2nd level, a stonelord's flesh becomes progressively rockier. She gains a +1 natural armor {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Reduction}DR{/g} N/adamantine where N is equal to half her paladin level. The natural armor bonus increases by +1 at 6th level, and every four levels thereafter, to a maximum of +5 at 18th level.
c7f489a9-282f-4332-9b57-27e16b79e2cb: At 2nd level, the martyr and all allies within 20 feet of him gain a +4 morale {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throws{/g} against sonic effects and gaze {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacks{/g}. This ability functions only when the martyr is conscious.
8601c10b-8db3-4e5e-87a6-be694e6a421b: At 3rd level a divine guardian can intercept {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacks{/g} directed at the target of her divine troth as if she had the Bodyguard and In Harm's Way {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feats{/g}. The divine guardian's aura of courage does not grant a {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to allies within 10 feet, but still grants her immunity to fear effects.
b734f644-913f-4f58-b4ac-d06c8bc2c63d:
At 3rd level, a martyr can apply Mercy — Shaken, even if he didn't select that mercy (or its prerequisites). However, when he uses a mercy he didn't select, he loses his See No Evil, Hear No Evil aura for one {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g}. As long as martyr's aura is disabled, he cannot apply corresponding mercies.
At 6th level, a martyr can also apply Mercy — Dazed and Staggered, at 9th level — Confused, Cursed and Frightened, and at 12th level — Stunned and Paralyzed.
916203f8-ffc5-4c07-82ef-590066c8bfb5:
At 3rd level, a martyr can apply Mercy — Sickened and Fatigued, even if he didn't select that mercy (or its prerequisites). However, when he uses a mercy he didn't select, he loses his Aura of Health for one {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g}. As long as martyr's aura is disabled, he cannot apply corresponding mercies.
At 6th level, a martyr can also apply Mercy — Diseased, at 9th level — Nauseated, Exhausted and Poisoned, and at 12th level — Blinded.
2be830b2-ea0f-4c18-b7d7-2d7d64faeb16:
At 3rd level, a martyr can apply any of the mercies for which he qualifies based on his paladin level to his lay on hands, even if he didn't select that mercy (or its prerequisites). However, when he uses a mercy he didn't select, he loses his Aura of {g|Encyclopedia:HP}Health{/g} or See No Evil, Hear No Evil aura (depending on the mercy) for one {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g}. As long as martyr's aura is disabled, he cannot apply corresponding mercies.
The martyr can use lay on hands on any ally within short range, rather than needing to touch the ally.
901eb921-1c72-405a-ace1-4fef945d75fc: At 3rd level, a paladin is immune to all diseases, including supernatural and magical diseases, including mummy rot.
a314f5c7-5029-41c3-85c6-28c8d11e6443:
At 3rd level, a paladin is immune to fear (magical or otherwise). Each ally within 10 feet of her gains a +4 morale {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throws{/g} against fear effects.
This ability functions only while the paladin is conscious, not if she is {g|Encyclopedia:Injury_Death}unconscious{/g} or dead.
2573deff-a716-41e1-8dfd-4a862f1a7725:
At 3rd level, a stonelord's vitals begin to calcify and her blood transforms into liquid stone. She gains a 25% chance to ignore a {g|Encyclopedia:Critical}critical hit{/g} or precision {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g}. This does not stack with fortification armor or similar effects.
At 9th level, this chance increases to 50% and she becomes immune to petrification.
At 15th level, this chance increases to 75% and she becomes immune to bleed.
36ca4761-86be-45a6-bade-b40c408ba099:
At 3rd level, and every three levels thereafter, a paladin can select one mercy.
Each mercy adds an effect to the paladin's lay on hands ability. Whenever the paladin uses lay on hands to {g|Encyclopedia:Healing}heal{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} to one target, the target also receives the additional effects from all of the mercies possessed by the paladin.
33c07588-3c8e-44f2-88ce-e74308cb3634: At 3rd level, the martyr and all allies within 20 feet of him gain a +4 morale {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throws{/g} against diseases. This ability functions only when the martyr is conscious.
a7010a1b-f865-44c6-8b99-ba3b1248b7c3: At 3rd level, when a divine hunter hits a creature with a {g|Encyclopedia:RangedAttack}ranged attack{/g}, she grants her allies within 10 feet of her the benefit of the Precise Shot {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feat{/g} against that target for 1 {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g}. Her allies must remain within 10 feet of her, and must be able both to see and hear the divine hunter to gain this benefit.
dafab609-2f79-431d-a4f8-a08581d5d844: At 4th level, the warrior of the holy light gains one additional use of her lay on hands ability per day. She gains one additional use of lay on hands per day for every four levels she attains beyond 4th. She can spend a use of her lay on hands ability to call upon the power of her faith as a {g|Encyclopedia:Standard_Actions}standard action{/g}. This causes a nimbus of light to emanate from the warrior of the holy light in a 30-foot radius. All allies in this area (including the warrior of the holy light) receive a +1 morale {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g} and on {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack rolls{/g}, {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage rolls{/g}, and {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throws{/g} against fear as long as they remain in the area of light. This power lasts for 1 minute.
d8941185-c8f1-4597-adde-337049160bfb: At 5th level, you gain an insight {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} equal to your {g|Encyclopedia:Charisma}Charisma{/g} modifier on all Lore and Knowledge {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skill checks{/g}.
3c4cd8dd-e34a-4e8b-b3a4-d03e2a8571ac:
At 6th level, a divine hunter can expend two uses of her lay on hands ability to use her lay on hands ability on a target within 5 feet per paladin level.
A paladin can {g|Encyclopedia:Healing}heal{/g} the wounds of others by touch. With one use of this ability, a paladin can heal {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:HP}hit points{/g} of damage for every two paladin levels she possesses. Using this ability is a {g|Encyclopedia:Standard_Actions}standard action{/g}.
Alternatively, a paladin can use this healing power to deal {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} to undead creatures, dealing 1d6 points of damage for every two levels the paladin possesses. Using lay on hands in this way requires a successful melee {g|Encyclopedia:TouchAttack}touch attack{/g} and doesn't provoke an {g|Encyclopedia:Attack_Of_Opportunity}attack of opportunity{/g}. Undead do not receive a {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throw{/g} against this damage.
c16db816-c1b2-4e53-a27d-722739d1c30d: At 8th level, a paladin is immune to blindness (magical or otherwise). Each ally within 10 feet of her gains a +4 morale {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throws{/g} against blindness effects.
48bfce1b-87a7-449f-951a-b59e323e619e:
At 8th level, a paladin is immune to charm {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:Special_Abilities}spell-like abilities{/g}. Each ally within 10 feet of her gains a +4 morale {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throws{/g} against charm effects.
This ability functions only while the paladin is conscious, not if she is {g|Encyclopedia:Injury_Death}unconscious{/g} or dead.
1b509f1f-03a9-41d8-b5f9-3b6e66011d38: At 8th level, the nimbus of light heals the paladin and her allies, {g|Encyclopedia:Healing}curing{/g} of them of {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d4{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:AbilityDamage}ability damage{/g}, as per the {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} lesser restoration. A creature can only be healed in this way once per day.
61256976-2341-46d3-8e0f-d3323ba71cd8:
Beginning at 2nd level, a paladin can {g|Encyclopedia:Healing}heal{/g} wounds (her own or those of others) by touch. Each day she can use this ability a number of times equal to 1/2 her paladin level plus her {g|Encyclopedia:Charisma}Charisma{/g} modifier. With one use of this ability, a paladin can heal {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:HP}hit points{/g} of damage for every two paladin levels she possesses. Using this ability is a {g|Encyclopedia:Standard_Actions}standard action{/g}, unless the paladin targets herself or her divine troth, in which case it is a {g|Encyclopedia:Swift_Action}swift action{/g}. Despite the name of this ability, a paladin only needs one free hand to use this ability.
Alternatively, a paladin can use this healing power to deal {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} to undead creatures, dealing 1d6 points of damage for every two levels the paladin possesses. Using lay on hands in this way requires a successful melee {g|Encyclopedia:TouchAttack}touch attack{/g} and doesn't provoke an {g|Encyclopedia:Attack_Of_Opportunity}attack of opportunity{/g}. Undead do not receive a {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throw{/g} against this damage.
0a783318-a0f5-49a6-9e97-20170b1fe22c:
Beginning at 2nd level, a paladin can {g|Encyclopedia:Healing}heal{/g} wounds (her own or those of others) by touch. Each day she can use this ability a number of times equal to 1/2 her paladin level plus her {g|Encyclopedia:Charisma}Charisma{/g} modifier. With one use of this ability, a paladin can heal {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:HP}hit points{/g} of damage for every two paladin levels she possesses. Using this ability is a {g|Encyclopedia:Standard_Actions}standard action{/g}, unless the paladin targets herself, in which case it is a {g|Encyclopedia:Swift_Action}swift action{/g}.
Alternatively, a paladin can use this healing power to deal {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} to undead creatures, dealing 1d6 points of damage for every two levels the paladin possesses. Using lay on hands in this way requires a successful melee {g|Encyclopedia:TouchAttack}touch attack{/g} and doesn't provoke an {g|Encyclopedia:Attack_Of_Opportunity}attack of opportunity{/g}. Undead do not receive a {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throw{/g} against this damage.
70e3eb0e-5db6-49fe-86fb-f83d5ca21387: Divine bond allows the paladin to forge a connection to either an animal companion, or a deity. Bond with an animal allows them to choose one of the available creatures who becomes their faithful companion, can wear barding, and advances along with the paladin. Bond with a deity lets the paladin empower their weapon.
30e8bc16-c50c-427d-86f5-970c2c5adbb3: Divine hunters are proficient with all simple and {g|Encyclopedia:Weapon_Proficiency}martial weapons{/g}, with light and medium armor, and with shields (except tower shields).
30ae98a3-63bf-4f4c-8881-6a2c4b9d8065: Divine scions are paladins who improve their battle prowess not only through faith, but also through knowledge. They study their enemies to find the most efficient methods of dealing with them.
1eb04b33-9d1f-4859-afd0-64821af2e4a1: Every paladin's code instructs him to put the welfare of others before his own, but some paladins take this farther than most, shouldering the direst suffering of the world onto themselves in order to help others and inspiring their allies to achieve heights of valor rather than seeking the glory for themselves.
ddd3a362-a9ec-4fd3-930f-b5a91f76f6b4: Lay on Hands is a unique ability that allows the paladins to {g|Encyclopedia:Healing}heal{/g} themselves and their allies. As a paladin advances, they improve this ability, learning to remove various negative conditions with it.
ebc3ab9e-f051-4ccd-9768-8863fd12e6c3: Most paladins rush into battle, meeting evil toe to toe. The divine hunter prefers to engage evil from afar, striking down her foes before they can threaten her allies.
edb9e016-38ad-4f34-ba2b-5efd8943c5b4: Once per day per paladin level, a stonelord can draw upon the power of the living rock. As a {g|Encyclopedia:Swift_Action}swift action{/g}, she treats her {g|Encyclopedia:MeleeAttack}melee attacks{/g} until the beginning of her next turn (whether armed or {g|Encyclopedia:UnarmedAttack}unarmed{/g}) as magical and adamantine with a +1 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage rolls{/g}. This bonus increases by +1 at 5th level and every 5 levels thereafter.
73508dd0-a9bf-449d-a334-78a6cdd24638: Once per day the divine guardian pledges her protection to a willing creature for the day.
b9d25680-e6b7-4b6f-b35c-376ac8498251: Paladin can choose an {g|Encyclopedia:Alignment}evil-aligned{/g} enemy creature and gain significant advantages against it, bolstering their chance to hit, {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} output, and protection. This ability can be used a limited number of times per day.
a7cb58ca-1c28-4e7c-9baa-4de8d5ba6bd3: Paladins are fighting evil on the front lines. They are good at destroying especially powerful evil creatures. As they advance, they gain access to a small number of basic divine {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g}, focusing mostly on {g|Encyclopedia:Healing}healing{/g} and empowering themselves and their allies. A paladin must have a Lawful Good {g|Encyclopedia:Alignment}alignment{/g}, or they will lose most of their powers.
2e70f84c-d000-4ed9-b6b4-9f82433b08ce: Paladins are known for their charity and for tending to the sick. The hospitaler takes to this calling above all others, spending much of her time {g|Encyclopedia:Healing}healing{/g} the poor, and giving aid and succor to those in need.
93c003f9-9f4e-4732-adf0-80150e24df1b: Paladins are proficient with all simple and {g|Encyclopedia:Weapon_Proficiency}martial weapons{/g}, with all types of armor (heavy, medium, and light), and with shields (except tower shields).
3e2e5b73-73f8-4ec6-846f-1014fe08da84: Paladins serve as beacons for their allies within the chaos of battle. While deadly opponents of evil, they can also empower goodly souls to aid in their crusades. Their magic and martial {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skills{/g} also make them well suited to defending others and blessing the fallen with the strength to continue fighting.
ba914739-765e-45f5-bab0-645cf5d2f408: See No Evil, Hear No Evil
583bfed7-ab6a-49f4-baa0-d46df1c18467: Some paladins use their gifts to focus on the holy light that shines within their souls. With the gifts of purity and redemption, these paladins spend much of their lives helping others find the true path. Unleashing this power takes patience and comes at a steep price.
8f53dd0e-4372-4fbc-ba6f-00a426e32837: Special {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}Attacks{/g}: The creature may smite evil once a day as a {g|Encyclopedia:Swift_Action}swift action{/g} (it adds its {g|Encyclopedia:Charisma}Charisma{/g} bonus to attack rolls, and a {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} equal to its {g|Encyclopedia:Hit_Dice}HD{/g} against evil foes; smite persists until the target is dead or the creature rests).
7a0eb0b7-0185-4f58-a0ef-e50b0d6f6c33: The divine guardian can intercept a successful {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} against the target of her divine troth ability once per {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g}, taking full {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} from that attack and any associated effects.
5c1800aa-68ed-4253-95f5-af9e96dbdba3:
The divine guardian devotes herself to the protection and guardianship of one creature at a time, be that her liege lord, an allied cleric, or an innocent facing overwhelming danger at the hands of evil.
The divine guardian devotes herself to the concerns of the material world, eschewing some divine studies. She does not gain access to divine {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spellcasting{/g}.
56a4b232-38c0-4bb4-82c4-36cbab38dd9f: The martyr's aura of courage, aura of resolve, and aura of righteousness have a radius of 20 feet instead of 10 feet, but the martyr does not gain immunity to fear, charms, or compulsions from those abilities.
b0388551-f3f6-4555-9f6c-b785c19a8c73: This protective aura provides a +4 deflection {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g} and a +4 resistance bonus on {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throws{/g} against {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacks{/g} made or effects created by evil creatures to anyone within 20 feet. Otherwise, it functions as a magic circle against evil and a lesser globe of invulnerability, both with a radius of 20 feet.
8e3fa18c-1f58-422b-883d-5b35d92b7df5: This weapon emits a magic circle against evil effect. All creatures within the area gain the effects of a protection from evil {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}.
e78bc09a-2d5b-450a-9080-9dce0f804efd:
Upon reaching 5th level, a divine hunter forms a divine bond with her ranged weapon. As a {g|Encyclopedia:Standard_Actions}standard action{/g}, she can call upon the aid of a celestial spirit for 1 minute per paladin level.
At 5th level, this spirit grants the weapon a +1 enhancement {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g}. For every three levels beyond 5th, the weapon gains another +1 enhancement bonus, to a maximum of +6 at 20th level. These bonuses can be added to the weapon, stacking with existing weapon bonuses to a maximum of +5.
Alternatively, they can be used to add any of the following weapon properties: axiomatic, brilliant energy, flaming, flaming burst, holy, keen, merciful, and speed. Adding these properties consumes an amount of bonus equal to the property's cost. These bonuses are added to any properties the weapon already has, but duplicate abilities do not stack.
A paladin can use this ability once per day at 5th level, and one additional time per day for every four levels beyond 5th, to a total of four times per day at 17th level.
104411ed-beca-405b-a064-5ce611907122:
Upon reaching 5th level, a paladin forms a divine bond with her god. This bond can take one of two forms. Once the form is chosen, it cannot be changed.
The first type of bond allows a paladin to form a divine bond with her weapon. As a {g|Encyclopedia:Standard_Actions}standard action{/g}, she can call upon the aid of a celestial spirit for 1 minute per paladin level.
At 5th level, this spirit grants the weapon a +1 enhancement {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g}. For every three levels beyond 5th, the weapon gains another +1 enhancement bonus, to a maximum of +6 at 20th level. These bonuses can be added to the weapon, stacking with existing weapon bonuses to a maximum of +5.
Alternatively, they can be used to add any of the following weapon properties: axiomatic, brilliant energy, disruption, flaming, flaming burst, holy, keen, and speed. Adding these properties consumes an amount of bonus equal to the property's cost. These bonuses are added to any properties the weapon already has, but duplicate abilities do not stack.
A paladin can use this ability once per day at 5th level, and one additional time per day for every four levels beyond 5th, to a total of four times per day at 17th level.
The second type of bond allows a paladin to gain the service of an unusually intelligent, strong, and loyal steed to serve her in her crusade against evil. This mount is a heavy horse. This mount functions as a druid's animal companion, using the paladin's level as her effective druid level.
At 11th level, the mount gains the celestial creature simple template.
At 15th level, a paladin's mount gains {g|Encyclopedia:Spell_Resistance}spell resistance{/g} equal to the paladin's level + 11.
774ed9a0-6ef5-4aaa-94f9-0b26f6b4a4e9:
Upon reaching 5th level, a paladin forms a divine bond with her weapon. As a {g|Encyclopedia:Standard_Actions}standard action{/g}, she can call upon the aid of a celestial spirit for 1 minute per paladin level.
At 5th level, this spirit grants the weapon a +1 enhancement {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g}. For every three levels beyond 5th, the weapon gains another +1 enhancement bonus, to a maximum of +6 at 20th level. These bonuses can be added to the weapon, stacking with existing weapon bonuses to a maximum of +5.
Alternatively, they can be used to add any of the following weapon properties: axiomatic, brilliant energy, defending, disruption, flaming, flaming burst, holy, keen, and speed. Adding these properties consumes an amount of bonus equal to the property's cost (see Table: Melee Weapon Special Abilities). These bonuses are added to any properties the weapon already has, but duplicate abilities do not stack.
A paladin can use this ability once per day at 5th level, and one additional time per day for every four levels beyond 5th, to a total of four times per day at 17th level.
354ca0a9-a0e5-44bc-bba6-0be1992ca58e:
Upon reaching 5th level, a paladin forms a divine bond with her weapon. As a {g|Encyclopedia:Standard_Actions}standard action{/g}, she can call upon the aid of a celestial spirit for 1 minute per paladin level.
At 5th level, this spirit grants the weapon a +1 enhancement {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g}. For every three levels beyond 5th, the weapon gains another +1 enhancement bonus, to a maximum of +6 at 20th level. These bonuses can be added to the weapon, stacking with existing weapon bonuses to a maximum of +5.
Alternatively, they can be used to add any of the following weapon properties: axiomatic, brilliant energy, defending, disruption, flaming, flaming burst, holy, keen, merciful, and speed. Adding these properties consumes an amount of bonus equal to the property's cost. These bonuses are added to any properties the weapon already has, but duplicate abilities do not stack.
A paladin can use this ability once per day at 5th level, and one additional time per day for every four levels beyond 5th, to a total of four times per day at 17th level.
e3a08d38-6f3d-49e7-b993-b8bf283563b4:
Upon reaching 5th level, a paladin forms a divine bond with her weapon. As a {g|Encyclopedia:Standard_Actions}standard action{/g}, she can call upon the aid of a celestial spirit for 1 minute per paladin level.
At 5th level, this spirit grants the weapon a +1 enhancement {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g}. For every three levels beyond 5th, the weapon gains another +1 enhancement bonus, to a maximum of +6 at 20th level. These bonuses can be added to the weapon, stacking with existing weapon bonuses to a maximum of +5.
Alternatively, they can be used to add any of the following weapon properties: axiomatic, brilliant energy, disruption, flaming, flaming burst, holy, keen, and speed. Adding these properties consumes an amount of bonus equal to the property's cost. These bonuses are added to any properties the weapon already has, but duplicate abilities do not stack.
A paladin can use this ability once per day at 5th level, and one additional time per day for every four levels beyond 5th, to a total of four times per day at 17th level.
71b4971b-1889-4846-992b-ee20f3bd040d:
When a hospitaler reaches 4th level, she gains the {g|Encyclopedia:Special_Abilities}supernatural ability{/g} to channel positive energy like a cleric. She can use this ability a number of times per day equal to 3 + her {g|Encyclopedia:Charisma}Charisma{/g} modifier. Using this ability does not expend uses of lay on hands, as it does with other paladins. This energy can be used to cause or {g|Encyclopedia:Healing}heal{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g}, depending on the creatures targeted.
A hospitaler channels positive energy and can choose to deal damage to undead creatures or to heal living creatures.
Channeling positive energy causes a burst that affects all creatures of one type (either undead or living) in a 30-foot radius centered on the hospitaler. The amount of damage dealt or healed is equal to {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} points of damage at 4th level plus 1d6 points of damage for every two hospitaler levels beyond 4th (2d6 at 6th, 3d6 at 8th, and so on). Creatures that take damage from channeled energy receive a {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Will save{/g} to halve the damage. The {g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} of this save is equal to 10 + 1/2 the hospitaler's level + the hospitaler's Charisma modifier. Creatures healed by channel energy cannot exceed their maximum {g|Encyclopedia:HP}hit point{/g} total—all excess healing is lost.
This is a {g|Encyclopedia:Standard_Actions}standard action{/g} that does not provoke an {g|Encyclopedia:Attack_Of_Opportunity}attack of opportunity{/g}.
12b466ab-13f7-418a-b5b7-df7887499e9d:
When a paladin reaches 4th level, she gains the {g|Encyclopedia:Special_Abilities}supernatural ability{/g} to channel positive energy like a cleric. Using this ability consumes two uses of her lay on hands ability. This energy can be used to cause or {g|Encyclopedia:Healing}heal{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g}, depending on the creatures targeted.
A paladin channels positive energy and can choose to deal damage to undead creatures or to heal living creatures.
Channeling positive energy causes a burst that affects all creatures of one type (either undead or living) in a 30-foot radius centered on the paladin. The amount of damage dealt or healed is equal to {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} points of damage plus 1d6 points of damage for every two paladin levels beyond 1st (2d6 at 4th, 3d6 at 5th, and so on). Creatures that take damage from channeled energy receive a {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Will save{/g} to halve the damage. The {g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} of this save is equal to 10 + 1/2 the paladin's level + the paladin's {g|Encyclopedia:Charisma}Charisma{/g} modifier. Creatures healed by channel energy cannot exceed their maximum {g|Encyclopedia:HP}hit point{/g} total—all excess healing is lost.
This is a {g|Encyclopedia:Standard_Actions}standard action{/g} that does not provoke an {g|Encyclopedia:Attack_Of_Opportunity}attack of opportunity{/g}.
dc96bd39-d980-47e2-8d8c-34bd87c0845b: When a target of the divine guardian's divine troth ability is {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacked{/g}, she may use an {g|Encyclopedia:Attack_Of_Opportunity}attack of opportunity{/g} to provide her ally with a +4 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g}.
a2f81c73-5d01-43ab-9399-7ece996d784f: Whenever the paladin uses lay on hands to {g|Encyclopedia:Healing}heal{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} to one target, the paladin's lay on hands ability also acts as neutralize poison, using the paladin's level as the {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster level{/g}.
61384e65-7e57-416f-85f8-340e0be77c5c: Whenever the paladin uses lay on hands to {g|Encyclopedia:Healing}heal{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} to one target, the paladin's lay on hands ability also acts as remove curse, using the paladin's level as the {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster level{/g}.
c812fa44-c5de-47b3-bb46-4381d2d967a0: Whenever the paladin uses lay on hands to {g|Encyclopedia:Healing}heal{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} to one target, the paladin's lay on hands ability also acts as remove disease, using the paladin's level as the {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster level{/g}.
f81f444d-df15-414c-aaeb-5d46cc059195: Whenever the paladin uses lay on hands to {g|Encyclopedia:Healing}heal{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} to one target, the target is no longer blinded.
882241c4-fd52-4eea-8a2d-d5720c97e442: Whenever the paladin uses lay on hands to {g|Encyclopedia:Healing}heal{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} to one target, the target is no longer confused.
97a0fda6-ff86-46f1-a884-476338fc1397: Whenever the paladin uses lay on hands to {g|Encyclopedia:Healing}heal{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} to one target, the target is no longer dazed.
b465f16a-f546-4758-a5bd-36f5a0afb534: Whenever the paladin uses lay on hands to {g|Encyclopedia:Healing}heal{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} to one target, the target is no longer exhausted. The paladin must have the fatigue mercy before selecting this mercy.
daf00fa7-adde-4b7a-81ad-8bb83f23110b: Whenever the paladin uses lay on hands to {g|Encyclopedia:Healing}heal{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} to one target, the target is no longer fatigued.
0e7d9c42-8357-40b0-9612-dd4ea56fb887: Whenever the paladin uses lay on hands to {g|Encyclopedia:Healing}heal{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} to one target, the target is no longer frightened. The paladin must have the shaken mercy before selecting this mercy.
1b511285-ffff-48d1-a28f-d7019f94ff0e: Whenever the paladin uses lay on hands to {g|Encyclopedia:Healing}heal{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} to one target, the target is no longer nauseated. The paladin must have the sickened mercy before selecting this mercy.
2f40b20a-f145-4cf1-9be1-2633fc77e4aa: Whenever the paladin uses lay on hands to {g|Encyclopedia:Healing}heal{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} to one target, the target is no longer paralyzed.
9bb43309-874d-45e0-9b5e-35fac7841162: Whenever the paladin uses lay on hands to {g|Encyclopedia:Healing}heal{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} to one target, the target is no longer shaken.
8af891bb-1211-4d6c-b5aa-c79eb076457d: Whenever the paladin uses lay on hands to {g|Encyclopedia:Healing}heal{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} to one target, the target is no longer sickened.
c0af7401-99d5-40cb-b808-3584e438f89f: Whenever the paladin uses lay on hands to {g|Encyclopedia:Healing}heal{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} to one target, the target is no longer staggered.
6562eeb2-0437-4389-9cc8-5f1c22ca78f6: Whenever the paladin uses lay on hands to {g|Encyclopedia:Healing}heal{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} to one target, the target is no longer stunned.
